metadata.title: CVE-2020-29374 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.7.3, related tomm/gup.c and mm/huge_memory.c. The get_user_pages (aka gup) implementation,when used for a copy-on-write page, does not properly consider thesemantics of read operations and therefore can grant unintended writeaccess, aka CID-17839856fd58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-lowlatency - 5.4.0-45.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-kvm - 5.4.0-1021.21
No subscription required
